criteria: Accuracy in telling and writing time to the nearest minute
Ability to measure time intervals in minutes
Problem-solving skills in addition and subtraction of time intervals
Representation of time intervals using number line diagrams
descriptions: Unable to tell or write time to the nearest hour.
Can tell and write time to the nearest hour, but struggles with minutes.
Can tell and write time to the nearest 15 minutes with some errors.
Can tell and write time to the nearest 5 minutes with occasional errors.
Can tell and write time to the nearest minute with minor errors or inconsistencies.
Consistently and accurately tells and writes time to the nearest minute.
Unable to measure or identify time intervals.
Can measure time intervals in hours, but not accurately in minutes.
Can measure simple time intervals (e.g., 30 minutes) but struggles with more complex intervals.
Can measure most time intervals in minutes, but makes errors when crossing the hour mark.
Accurately measures time intervals in minutes with only occasional errors.
Consistently and accurately measures a variety of time intervals in minutes, including those crossing the hour mark.
Unable to solve word problems involving time intervals.
Attempts to solve word problems but struggles with the concept of time intervals.
Can solve simple addition and subtraction problems involving time intervals with significant errors.
Solves most addition and subtraction problems involving time intervals, but makes calculation errors.
Accurately solves addition and subtraction problems involving time intervals, with only minor errors in calculations or representation.
Consistently and accurately solves complex word problems involving addition and subtraction of time intervals, demonstrating a strong understanding of time concepts and problem-solving strategies.
Unable to create or use a number line diagram to represent time intervals.
Attempts to create a number line but is unable to accurately represent time intervals.
Can create a basic number line diagram with some correct representations of time intervals, but significant gaps in understanding.
Creates a number line diagram that accurately represents most time intervals, but may have minor inconsistencies in scale or labeling.
Effectively uses number line diagrams to accurately represent and solve problems involving time intervals.

Creates clear, accurate, and detailed number line diagrams to effectively represent and solve complex problems involving addition and subtraction of time intervals, demonstrating a thorough understanding of the concept.
